SImon.sisndmasswind.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
SImon.sisndmasswind.comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to wind-driven transport into the ocean divided by grid-cell area.

SImon.sisnhc.comment: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.

SImon.sisnmass.comment: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This then allows one to analyse the storage of latent heat in the snow, and to calculate the snow-water equivalent.

SImon.sisnmassacrossline.comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

SImon.sisnmassn.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North
SImon.sisnmassn.comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

SImon.sisnmasss.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South
SImon.sisnmasss.comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

SImon.sisnthick.cell_methods: area: mean where snow over sea_ice area: time: mean where sea_ice
SImon.sisnthick.comment: Actual thickness of snow averaged over the snow-covered part of the sea ice. This thickness is usually directly available within the model formulation. It can also be derived by dividing the total volume of snow by the area of the snow.

SImon.sispeed.comment: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice.

SImon.sistressave.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
SImon.sistressave.long_name: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice
SImon.sistressave.comment: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).

SImon.sistressmax.cell_methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
SImon.sistressmax.long_name: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice
SImon.sistressmax.comment: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).

SImon.sistrxdtop.long_name: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistrxdtop.comment: X-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

SImon.sistrxubot.long_name: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistrxubot.comment: X-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.

SImon.sistrydtop.long_name: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistrydtop.comment: Y-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

SImon.sistryubot.long_name: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
SImon.sistryubot.comment: Y-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.

SImon.sitempbot.comment: Mean temperature at the base of the sea ice, NOT the temperature within lowermost sea-ice model layer.

SImon.sitempsnic.comment: Mean temperature at the snow-ice interface. This is the surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero.

SImon.sitemptop.comment: Mean surface temperature of the sea-ice covered part of the grid cell. Wherever snow covers the ice, the surface temperature of the snow is used for the averaging, otherwise the surface temperature of the ice is used.

SImon.sithick.comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice averaged over the ice-covered part of a given grid cell, NOT volume divided by grid area.

SImon.sitimefrac.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sitimefrac.long_name: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
SImon.sitimefrac.comment: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc > 0) in a grid cell.

SImon.siu.comment: X-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

SImon.siv.comment: Y-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

SImon.sivol.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
SImon.sivol.comment: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area, also known as the equivalent thickness of sea ice.

SImon.sivoln.comment: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

SImon.sivols.comment: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.
